title: Telemeter Glacier
text: Telemeter Glacier () is a small <a href="glacier">glacier</a> 1 mile (1.6 km) southwest of <a href="Fireman%20Glacier">Fireman Glacier</a> in the west part of <a href="Quartermain%20Mountains">Quartermain Mountains</a>, <a href="Victoria%20Land">Victoria Land</a>, Antarctica. The name is one of a group in the area associated with <a href="surveying">surveying</a> applied in 1993 by <a href="New%20Zealand%20Geographic%20Board">New Zealand Geographic Board</a> (NZGB); <a href="telemeter%20%28rangefinder%29">telemeter</a> being an instrument used to ascertain ranges and distances.
